name: x402
summary: Elegant resurrection of HTTP 402. The simplicity is genuinely Whitehead-like — pay-per-request without accounts. But autonomous agent payments without human oversight introduce a novel 'sorcerer's apprentice' risk that Asparouhova warns about: protocols that run unchecked.

feedbackLoop.note: 402 → pay → 200 is maximally transparent. Payment receipts on-chain.

edgeCases.note: Single, clear flow. Facilitator handles complexity.

ambiguity.note: V2 introduces deferred payments, credit billing — ambiguity creeping in.

redundancy.note: Overlaps with AP2 for agent payments. x402 Foundation + AP2 extension creates layering.

nesting.note: Facilitator chain: agent → server → facilitator → blockchain. Failure at any point is opaque to the agent.

exitCost.note: 100M+ payments processed. Network effects building. Coinbase facilitator has ~70% share.

identityPenetration.note: x402 developers identify with the 'internet money' narrative. Token prices of related projects surging — financial identity layer.

agencyPreservation.note: Agents pay autonomously. The HUMAN is increasingly removed from the payment loop — agency transferred to protocol.

controlInvisibility.note: Micropayments are designed to be invisible. By definition, you stop noticing them. This is the speed bump problem.

crisisMindset.note: 'The internet needs native payments NOW' — urgency framing drives adoption.
